FuncDef:
The delay-measure two-way threshold command sets an alarm threshold for two-way frame delay measurement.
The undo delay-measure two-way threshold command removes the alarm threshold set for two-way frame delay measurement.
By default, no alarm threshold is configured for two-way frame delay measurement.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the alarm threshold of two-way frame delay measurement.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295, in microseconds

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The delay-measure two-way threshold command sets a delay threshold on a network enabled with two-way frame delay measurement. If the delay time exceeds the configured threshold, an alarm is generated and sent to the NMS. An administrator obtains alarm information and takes measures to rectify the fault that causes the delay to ensure service quality.
The delay-measure two-way threshold command can be used in the VLAN scenario.
Prerequisites
The cfm md md-name command has been run to configure an MD, and the ma ma-name command has been run to configure an MA.
